{{cpp/title | gets}}
{{cpp/io/c/navbar}}
{{ddcl | header=cstdio | deprecated=c++11 | removed=c++14 |
char* gets( char* str );
}}

Reads {{lc|stdin}} into given character string until a newline character is found or end-of-file occurs.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | str | character string to be written}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{tt|str}} on success, a null pointer on failure.

If the failure has been caused by end of file condition, additionally sets the ''eof'' indicator (see {{lc|std::feof()}}) on {{lc|stdin}}. If the failure has been caused by some other error, sets the ''error'' indicator (see {{lc|std::ferror()}}) on {{lc|stdin}}.

===Notes===
The {{tt|std::gets()}} function does not perform bounds checking. Therefore, this function is extremely vulnerable to buffer-overflow attacks. It cannot be used safely (unless the program runs in an environment which restricts what can appear on {{tt|stdin}}). For this reason, the function was deprecated in C++11 and removed altogether in C++14. {{lc|std::fgets()}} may be used instead.

===Example===
{{example|code=
#include &lt;array&gt;
#include &lt;cstdio&gt;
#include &lt;cstring&gt;

int main()
{
    std::puts("Never use std::gets(). Use std::fgets() instead!");

    std::array&lt;char, 16&gt; buf;

    std::printf("Enter a string:\n&gt;");

    if (std::fgets(buf.data(), buf.size(), stdin))
    {
        const auto len = std::strlen(buf.data());
        std::printf(
            "The input string:\n[%s] is %s and has the length %li characters.\n",
            buf.data(), len + 1 &lt; buf.size() ? "not truncated" : "truncated", len
        );
    }
    else if (std::feof(stdin))
    {
        std::puts("Error: the end of stdin stream has been reached.");
    }
    else if (std::ferror(stdin))
    {
        std::puts("I/O error when reading from stdin.");
    }
    else
    {
        std::puts("Unknown stdin error.");
    }
}
|p=true
|output=
Never use std::gets(). Use std::fgets() instead!
Enter a string:
&gt;Living on Earth is expensive, but it does include a free trip around the Sun.
The input string:
[Living on Earth] is truncated and has the length 15 characters.
}}
